Definition:
In this study, we want to collect alternate possibilities, i.e., hypotheses that are contrary to the facts. Specifically, we provide a short story consisting of exactly 5 sentences. You need to change a key aspect of 2nd sentence so that the story continuation changes, but leaves a still interesting short story.  Please make sure that: The new sentence is closely related to the original 2nd sentence, rather than saying a totally irrelevant thing. The new sentence changes the subsequent storyline, so that at least one of the three subsequent sentences no longer work. Or in other words, the new sentence and the original subsequent sentences can no longer form a consistent story. Note that the new sentence does not have to change the whole subsequent storyline, but just some parts of it. The new sentence should make senses and be consistent with respect to the 1st sentence. 
 Things to avoid : Please make the new sentences simple and try to avoid complex sentences. 
 Emphasis & Caution: Sometimes you only need to change a few words in the original sentence to make a new one that satisfies the all requirements

Positive Examples.input:
Sentence 1: The cashier was counting the dollar bills at her desk. 
 Sentence 2: Two men rushed into the store and held their guns up. 
 Sentence 3: Everyone panicked and started to scream. 
  Sentence 4: The men threatened the people to remain quiet. 
 Sentence 5: The cashier handed them the cash so they would go away.
Positive Examples.output: Two dogs rushed into the store.
Positive Examples.explanation: Changed the entity “two men“ to “two dogs“ (This is a good edit because it satisfies all the three requirements above. Note that with the new sentence, the subsequent “The men threatened ...“ in the 4th sentence no longer holds. Thus the new sentence meets Requirement)

Positive Examples.input:
Sentence 1: Ben had a doctor's appointment. 
 Sentence 2: He was very scared. 
 Sentence 3: He never went to the doctor. 
 Sentence 4: He slowly stepped into the office. 
 Sentence 5: The doctor greeted him calmly and he felt better.
Positive Examples.output: He was in a rush to go to work after the appointment.
Positive Examples.explanation: The 4th sentence 'slowly stepped into' on longer holds.
